clusterLUTs 0.3.5
  • Reference

prepare shades and reorder to match cut

cutshades.Rd

For the given cut cut analyze the internal structure of each cluster and use that as basis for a shading through color.shades. Then reorder the shading to arrange according to cluster members.

cutshades(cut, col.fun = default.rgb, ...)

Arguments

cut

vector of cluster assignments
col.fun

function mapping a number to that many colors from a palette
...

passed to color.shades

Value

color shades reordered (see details)

Examples

set.seed(42);
(cs <- cutshades(ct <-  sample(6, 15, TRUE)))
#>           [,1]     [,2]      [,3] [,4]     [,5]     [,6]     [,7]     [,8]
#> [1,] 122.21130   0.0000 186.48405  255 140.3316  32.5686 191.0001 212.3436
#> [2,]  26.90505  63.9999  24.80640    0 184.6506 184.8903 255.0000 255.0000
#> [3,]  12.18135 255.0000   9.02955    0  23.9241  95.1201   0.0000 101.6991
#>           [,9]    [,10]    [,11]    [,12] [,13]    [,14]    [,15]
#> [1,] 255.00000   0.0000 255.0000 122.2266   255 120.7170 229.9488
#> [2,] 103.76205 255.0000 158.1102 109.1043     0 255.0000 255.0000
#> [3,]  70.32135 127.9998 129.3845 255.0000   255 160.4486 156.1722
#> attr(,"reps")
#> cut
#> 1 2 4 5 6 
#> 5 4 3 2 1 
#> attr(,"cut")
#>  [1] 1 5 1 1 2 4 2 2 1 4 1 5 6 4 2
#> attr(,"dir")
#> [1] "all"
op <- par(mfrow=2:1)
show.colmat(cs, width=15)
show.shades(cs)
par(op)
